page.title: 05EAST BURNHAM COTTAGE
page.content: East Burnham Cottage does not now stand but is part of another building known as East Burnham House.It is situated to the south of Stag Hill.In 1838 it was owned by George Grote.He was the author of "Standard history of Greece" written in the cottage.Mrs.Grote his wife,is said to have complained about the state of the roads and the footpaths,and the beer sold in "The Stag and Crown".She was a musical person and invited many famous friends to the cottage like Frederic Chopin(1810,1849) and Felix Mendelssohn(1809,1847).Mendelssohn,the great composer often visited the Beeches.Once while staying at East Burnham Cottage he got lost in the Beeches and had to be found by a search party.His favourite spot(which is now named after him)is called "Mendelssohn's slope".
